page.title: 01BOTHWELL WATER TO DUDDY LAW
page.content: On the eastern slopes of the Lammermuirs this area is dominated by the deep winding valley of the Bothwell water, a clear, clean, fast running stream. The hills to the east rise to 359 metres and are gently rolling. Very exposed with little shelter. Mainly rough grazing and heather here with blackface sheep which stay on the hill all winter, the main economic venture. Red Grouse are an important game bird shot on these hills. A large area of the block recently planted with spruce trees as an alternative to sheep farming. Human population sparse and confined to more sheltered valleys with agriculture supplying employment. Natural tree cover reduced to small patches of birch trees on valley sides.
